channel.title: PlayerLevel [PI]

item.title: PlayerLevel [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Nathan6 Nathan_
item.description:
@Nathan6 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:6, topic:439083”] if (c.playerLevel[14] >= 15) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151); } else { c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@At least level 15 mining.", 8151); }

You’re making this far too complicated. When you’re stating your argument in your if statement, as long as there no else if statements following all you have to do is make an else if you want the server to do something else if the original arguments are not met. Otherwise you can just close the if statement, it depends on the circumstances. The following code does the same exact as the code above.

if (c.playerLevel[14] >= 15) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151); } else if(c.playerLevel[14] < 15) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@At least level 15 mining.", 8151); } [/quote]Thanks mate.

Read full topic

item.title: PlayerLevel [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

if (c.playerLevel[14] >= 15) {
	c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151);
} else {
	c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@At least level 15 mining.", 8151);
}

You’re making this far too complicated. When you’re stating your argument in your if statement, as long as there no else if statements following all you have to do is make an else if you want the server to do something else if the original arguments are not met. Otherwise you can just close the if statement, it depends on the circumstances. The following code does the same exact as the code above.

if (c.playerLevel[14] >= 15) {
	c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151);
} else if(c.playerLevel[14] < 15) {
	c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@At least level 15 mining.", 8151);
}

Read full topic

item.title: PlayerLevel [PI]

item.description:
@Nathan6 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:4, topic:439083”][quote author=Nathan_ link=topic=541785.msg3968975#msg3968975 date=1333994815]

You’re definitely on the right track! I’ll give you a little hint and see if you can figure it out 

if (c.playerLevel[10] >= 15) {

If you need more help then that, ask on this thread and I’ll try to check back… Or if you definitely wanna contact me PM me.
[/quote]I changed the playerlevel to 14 cause that’s mining and it doesn’t strike it through.
Even though I do have 15 mining. Help?

Sorry about the 10/14 mishap, that’s my fault :P.

Anyways, what did you try doing? It won’t work the way I have it now, you’re going to have to create an } else {.[/quote]This is my current code:

			} else if (c.playerLevel[14] >= 15) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@At least level 15 mining.", 8151);

Is that correct? But that doesn’t work so I’m really confused.

Read full topic

item.title: PlayerLevel [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Nathan6 Nathan_
item.description:
@Nathan6 wrote:

Well I’ve added this into clickingbuttons.java

			case 28168:
		if(c.doricsQuest == 0) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("Doric's Quest", 8144);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 8145);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 8146);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("I can start this quest by speaking to Doric, the dwarf, near", 8147);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("Goblin Village near the crossing of Falador to Varrock.", 8148);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 8149);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("Minimum requirements are:", 8150);
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151);

But I need some help because where it says:

c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151);

I want to add something in so if they have 15 mining then it will strike it through.
I thought something like this…

c.getPA().sendFrame126("At least level 15 mining.", 8151);
			} else if(dont know what to put here == or here) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126("@str@At least level 15 mining.", 8151);

Could somebody please help me so that it will strike through if the player has 15 mining?

Read full topic
